page.title: 12Information in Saxilby Area
page.content: Saxilby Library opened at its present site in 1968. It has a readership of 1627 adults and 731 children, housing approximately 9650 books :- Adult Fiction General, Non-Fiction, Romances , Large-Print Books, Westerns, Mystery and Detection , Paperbacks, Teenage and Children's Section, plus a small collection of Local History and Reference books. It sells various maps, badges and publications. Opening hours are Monday to Friday 2 - 7 pm, Saturday 10am - 12.30pm. Books are issued for a period of 4 weeks, after which a fine of 15p per book per week is incurred. The average monthly issue is 4500. On registration readers are issued with a maximum of 6 tickets per person, children becoming adults at the age of 14. Books may be reserved at 15p each and requests are checked on the Computer Catalogue.
